analyze.description:
Description

Options to configure import map generation.
analyze.option:
Type: AnalyzeOptions/null

Available Sub-options:
  - detect-string-imports: Whether to detect imports from string literals. When enabled, Ruff will search for string
  - direction: Whether to generate a map from file to files that it depends on (dependencies) or files that
  - exclude: A list of file patterns to exclude from analysis in addition to the files excluded globally (see [`exclude`](#exclude), and [`extend-exclude`](#extend-exclude)).
  - include-dependencies: A map from file path to the list of Python or non-Python file paths or globs that should be
  - preview: Whether to enable preview mode. When preview mode is enabled, Ruff will expose unstable
  - string-imports-min-dots: The minimum number of dots in a string to consider it a valid import.
  - type-checking-imports: Whether to include imports that are only used for type checking (i.e., imports within `if TYPE_CHECKING:` blocks).
